org.elasticsearch.action.support.replication

Interface ReplicationOperation.Primary<Request extends ReplicationRequest<Request>,ReplicaRequest extends ReplicationRequest<ReplicaRequest>,PrimaryResultT extends ReplicationOperation.PrimaryResult<ReplicaRequest>>

      void failShard(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Exception exception)
      fail the primary, typically due to the fact that the operation has learned the primary has been demoted by the master

      • failShard

        void failShard(java.lang.String message,
               java.lang.Exception exception)
        fail the primary, typically due to the fact that the operation has learned the primary has been demoted by the master

      • perform

        PrimaryResultT perform(Request request)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs the given request on this primary. Yes, this returns as soon as it can with the request for the replicas and calls a listener when the primary request is completed. Yes, the primary request might complete before the method returns. Yes, it might also complete after. Deal with it.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to perform
        Returns:
        the request to send to the repicas
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
